title: Will schools be open in September? We asked several experts to weigh in
description: Many unanswered questions about Covid-19 testing, psychology, economic tensions, social distancing and work-from-home curriculum make opening up schools in September a hazy venture.

title: Amazon engineer quits after he 'snapped' when the company fired workers who called for coronavirus protections
description: Tim Bray, a senior engineer at Amazon, resigned on Friday over concerns about the company's decision to fire workers who were outspoken critics of its labor practices.

title: Apple and Google reveal what their coronavirus contact tracing system might look like
description: Google and Apple are backing a way to trace and notify people who may have been infected with Covid-19 using Bluetooth signals from people's phones anonymously.

title: FreshDirect co-founder Jason Ackerman said surge in online grocery shopping has led to more venture capital deals
description: FreshDirect co-founder and former CEO Jason Ackerman said customers' growing interest in online grocery shopping during the coronavirus pandemic has whet venture capital firms' appetites. "I'm seeing more deals in online grocery ... than I've ever seen before," he said.

title: Big Tech's earnings prove it's immune to the coronavirus
description: As many sectors reported devastation from the economic downturn, tech companies have proven largely resilient.

title: Salesforce will help businesses return to work with a new set of tools it just announced
description: Salesforce launched Work.com, which will have resources such as contact tracing, emergency response management and wellness assessments. It will also have a resource center with information from health experts and business leaders.
